turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm starving. Can you help me find some food? I'm open to anything, but I don't want to spend a fortune.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Of course! I can help with that. To give you the best recommendations, could you tell me your current location or a general area? Also, what's your preferred cuisine or any dietary restrictions?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm in downtown San Francisco, near Union Square. I like pretty much everything, except I'm trying to avoid gluten. Budget-wise, let's say under $20 per person, ideally.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, great! Based on your preferences, I recommend checking out "Marufuku Ramen" for delicious gluten-free ramen options. They are within your budget. Also, "Tacorea" has great gluten-free tacos, also relatively inexpensive and they have several locations in that area. I'll be able to provide a link if you wish.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ramen sounds amazing! But, how can ramen be gluten-free? Isn't the noodles made of wheat? And are the portions large?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: You're right, traditionally ramen noodles have gluten. However, Marufuku Ramen offers gluten-free ramen made with rice noodles! As for the portion sizes, they are generally considered generous. I am unable to provide estimates on portions beyond this information.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Perfect! Thanks for the helpful info! I'm feeling satisfied, I'll check it out!
